attributes.action: Not to raise staff ratios in early years
attributes.additional_details:
The ratios in early years are there for a reason. Raising the ratio will mean staff will leave the profession due to stress and workload. Early years staff are underpaid and stressed already, the Pandemic has seen nurseries closed and staff leaving to do less demanding jobs. 
There needs to be a change in the way the government sees early years education, especially in deprived areas. We educate, care and safeguard the children in our settings and it’s hard enough without higher ratios
attributes.background: Look at “free childcare” not ratios. The amount the nurseries get funded for child care does not cover staff wages or consumables at all. Settings charge extra to meet these costs. Stop treating early years educators as babysitters, we do not just supervise children, we educate and care for them!

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/615623
